stance_2: High stress increases my carb intake
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that high stress leads to increased carb intake, which in turn makes them feel worse.

stance_2: I do not believe I can be healthy without meat
justification: The belief that carbs make the interviewee feel worse supports the stance that they cannot be healthy without meat.

stance_2: I eat meat at every meal
justification: The dislike of how carbs make the interviewee feel supports the habit of eating meat at every meal.
The negative effects of carbs are contrasted with the positive effects of meat, reinforcing each other.

stance_2: I get inflammation when eating more carbs
justification: The interviewee directly states that more carbs cause inflammation and meat reduces it.
Reduction of inflammation is one way in which meat makes the interviewee feel better.

stance_1: Eating meat is natural for me
stance_2: I eat meat at every meal
justification: The interviewee describes eating meat at every meal as a natural habit.

stance_1: Eating meat is natural for me
justification: The interviewee implies that eating meat is natural because it is common among their social circle.

stance_1: I do not believe I can be healthy without meat
stance_2: I want to be healthy without meat
justification: The interviewee expresses a wish to be healthy without meat but explicitly states disbelief that it is possible.

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
justification: The interviewee eats meat at every meal because it makes them feel better.

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
justification: The social environment of meat-eating plausibly supports the interviewee's habit.

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
stance_2: Vegetarian and raw diets are hard to maintain
justification: The difficulty of maintaining vegetarian and raw diets supports the continuation of eating meat at every meal.

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
stance_2: Vegetarian and raw diets are expensive
justification: Costliness of alternative diets supports the habit of eating meat at every meal.

stance_1: I get inflammation when eating more carbs
justification: The interviewee explicitly connects feeling better from meat with reduced inflammation from lower carb intake.

stance_1: High stress increases my carb intake
stance_2: I want to be healthy without meat
justification: Increased carb intake under stress may undermine the aspiration to be healthy without meat, given carbs are viewed negatively.

stance_2: Vegetarian and raw diets are hard to maintain
justification: The positive feeling from meat and difficulty of alternatives both reinforce a preference for eating meat.

stance_2: Vegetarian and raw diets are expensive
justification: Positive experience with meat and negative experience with alternative diets both support continued meat eating.

stance_1: Vegetarian and raw diets are expensive
stance_2: Vegetarian and raw diets are hard to maintain
justification: The interviewee explicitly mentions both cost and difficulty as reasons these diets are not maintained.
